text: Gymnopis syntrema is a species of Caecilians. They belong to the family Caeciliidae. They live in Belize, Guatemala and Honduras. Their habitat is subtropical or tropical forests. Their populations are dying because of habitat loss. ==References== * Acevedo, M., Lee, J. & Wilkinson, M. 2004. Gymnopis syntrema. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 21 July 2007. ==Other websites== * Amphibian Web Category:Caecilians
title: Gymnopis syntrema
